reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night as I was flying out of Newark the next morning. One of the flaws of the hotel is that it is out of the way and not close to the airport but they do offer a free shuttle. For those reviewers that are complaining - you have to call the hotel ahead of time when you are in the shuttle bus area and the hotel will send the shuttle to the airport in 30 to 40 min to pick you up. You also have to let them know ahead of time what time you will be going back to the airport the next day to arrange your ride.
reviews.title: Affordable and Comfortable

reviews.text: The front desk staff looked stressed out but did not give me any attitude. She just needs to smile a bit more. The hotel environment was really homey and my room was a reasonable size, with a comfortable bed, clean washroom but unfortunately no fridge.
reviews.title: Nothing special, and a bit out of the way

reviews.text: The biggest perks of this hotel is the affordable price, the free airport shuttle, the free complete breakfast (not just bagels and muffins), free internet in the room. Unfortunately there is not much around the area so you may have to order food or go to the restaurant/bar downstairs (reasonable prices).
reviews.title: A little expensive but great bed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In all I enjoyed my stay here and I would consider coming back to this hotel if I have to stay the night to catch a flight the next morning.
reviews.title: Very nice stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was a surprisingly reasonable price not too far from Newark Airport (and they ran a shuttle). The rooms and the common areas were a bit dated, and the hotel was a bit out of the way if you didn't have a car (I got dropped off and then took the shuttle).
reviews.title: Some Limitations, But Nice Overall

reviews.text: Clean. Attractive Lobby.
reviews.title: Would Defintely stay there again.

reviews.text: Comfortable room. Competitive price. Good job
reviews.title: Good location, nice rooms, excellent staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Raddison is conveniently located about 5 miles south of Newark Airport, just off the NJ Turnpike. It's set in an industrial area but the hotel lobby and the rooms are always very neat and clean. The desk staff is always very friendly and helpful, especially Jason who always tries to go the extra mile for guests. Housekeeping staff is very polite and tries to stay quiet near rooms with late sleep-ins. We loved the comfort beds so much we bought one for our bedroom after one of our stays. Rates are reasonable. Breakfast buffet is okay but space near the food is tight. Only had dinner there a couple of times but the experience both times was less than satisfactory......hope it improves because the hotel overall is great.
reviews.title: What a wonderful place to stay while visiting NYC!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 3 days in NYC last July and we were simply astonished by the great service and amenities that we received at the Radisson Hotel in Carteret, New Jersey.
reviews.title: Much better than expected!

reviews.text: Fantastic room, very comfortable beds, helpful staff made our stay quite memorable.
reviews.title: Would stay here again

reviews.text: The hotel is 15 minutes away from Newark airport and located really close to toll roads entrance.They use sleep number bedding. Warm breakfast is complimentary every morning.
reviews.title: Good values for the money

reviews.text: Business center is available, although the computer is a bit old school. They have USA Today by the elevator for free. One complimentary bottle of water is provided in the room. Bathroom amenities are good. Not the best, but sufficient.
reviews.title: bad experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is surrounded by industries and/or manufacturing plants. But noise is minimal.
reviews.title: NOT SUITABLE FOR NEWARK AIRPORT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not sure if there is any train close by, but I drove to Newark Penn Station to take the PATH train to WTC station. You'll definitely need a car if you are going to stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Shame about the front office service

reviews.text: All front desk staff that I encountered seem to be hating their job. Not sure if manager treats them bad or just bad pay. But definitely needs improvement in this department.
reviews.title: Cheap and cheerful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Heading back from Atlantic City, we hit the October snowstorm. Knowing it would be unsafe to travel further we quickly got off the nearest exit and found the Radisson at Carteret. Snowing and cold, we entered the lobby to a warm fire and a welcoming front desk. Seasonal decor and a calm inviting atmosphere put me at ease. Check in was a breeze and the rate very reasonable for the area. A window in the room was leaking but we were quickly moved to another room without hesitation. Room was clean and spacious. Complimentary breakfast in the morning was fine, nothing fancy but hey its free. My one and only negative comment is that the smell of deodorizer was overpowering. Other than that the staff was great and I will consider Radisson's in the future. Thanks for the port in the storm!
reviews.title: A Wonderful Port in the Storm!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night while visiting the NYC/NJ area. It is just a short commute to Hoboken, NJ as we took in Carlos' Bakery. The hotel is sort of all on its own with no other hotels/motels in the area. There is a Dunkin Donuts no to far away along with various other stores. Area seemed safe with no issues at all. Property was clean and room was great! Only complaints would be their wifi service doesn't work so well. Weak signal on the 5th floor but worked well in the lobby. The other complaint is that for some reason you can hear doors closing from other rooms throughout the night. Continental breakfast was very good with a nice selection of items like scrambled eggs, bacon, home fries. Coffee was good too! Not quite enough tables though...they have booth seating and with just one person sitting at it you may have to ask to join the table.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the price.

reviews.text: The hotel is right off the turnpike. I had driven past it tons of times and you can see all the lanes of the turnpike from the hotel room.
reviews.title: Could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for everything else it has potential if they can address some issues. First of all the service is poor. There was one person throughout the weekend at the front desk even though she claimed there was full occupancy. She said the phone has been ringing all day. She and the other staff seemed to lack good customer service skills.
reviews.title: UNSATISFIED WITH SERVICE

reviews.text: Then there's the room. There was a panel or something below the thermostat that was open. This was rather odd. The tv remote was missing the cover for the battery. They can replace the crts with flat screens to free up some space in the room.
reviews.title: Middle of nowhere
